summary: This is an email chain from December 18-19, 2019, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY). It discusses media inquiries about video footage from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) related to Jeffrey Epstein's earlier attempted suicide while he was cellmates with Nicholas Tartaglione. The emails show internal coordination on how to respond to a reporter's questions, indicating the video was not preserved.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and accused sex trafficker. The email discusses the lack of preserved video footage from his earlier attempted suicide while incarcerated at the MCC, when he was cellmates with Nicholas Tartaglione.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: A defendant in a separate case who was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate at the MCC. His lawyer raised the issue about the missing Epstein suicide attempt video during a court proceeding.

persons.name: Jonathan Bandler
persons.context: A reporter (with Lohud/The Journal News) who was in court for Tartaglione's proceeding. He emailed the U.S. Attorney's Office seeking clarification on the status of video footage from Epstein's earlier attempted suicide.

connections.description: They were cellmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) when Epstein made an earlier suicide attempt.
Bandler, a reporter, contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office for clarification on the missing Epstein video footage, prompting the internal email discussion.

events.title: Court Proceeding for Nicholas Tartaglione
events.description: A court hearing for defendant Nicholas Tartaglione, during which his lawyer raised the issue that video footage from Jeffrey Epstein's earlier attempted suicide (when they were cellmates) was not preserved.

events.title: Media Inquiry on Epstein MCC Video
events.description: Reporter Jonathan Bandler contacts the U.S. Attorney's Office seeking clarification on whether video from Epstein's earlier suicide attempt at the MCC exists or was preserved.

events.title: Epstein's Earlier Attempted Suicide at MCC
events.description: A prior suicide attempt by Jeffrey Epstein while he was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center and sharing a cell with Nicholas Tartaglione. The existence and preservation of video footage from this incident is the subject of the email discussion.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York (SDNY)
keyFacts: The email chain reveals internal U.S. Attorney's Office discussions about how to respond to media inquiries regarding missing video footage from the MCC.
The missing video is from an earlier suicide attempt by Jeffrey Epstein, which occurred while he was cellmates with Nicholas Tartaglione.
During a court proceeding for Tartaglione, his lawyer stated it was their understanding the video "no longer exists, it was not preserved."
The emails indicate the U.S. Attorney's Office was in the process of looking into the video preservation issue at the judge's request.
The correspondence shows a media strategy was being formulated, with one official stating, "He's fixing the story. He has me declining to comment."
